column4: anyone knows how to get the new releases (to add to synaptic) from an *.iso I just mounted?
lololololol
mount the iso at /mnt/cdrom and run -> apt-cdrom add
it didn't worked
did you mount the iso at /mnt/cdrom?
what happens when you run apt-cdrom add ?
I get this error, among others -> E: Failed to mount the cdrom.
I know I've done this, but I think I'm forgetting something
my bad, mount it at /cdrom and it will work

I get this error:  'Ubuntu 5.04 _Hoary Hedgehog_ - Release i386 (20050407)'E: It wasn't possible to open the file /var/lib/apt/lists/partial/Ubuntu%205.04%20%5fHoary%20Hedgehog%5f%20-%20Release%20i386%20(20050407)_dists_unstable_main_binary-i386_Packages - open (13 Permission Denied)
it's not working for me now either :/
so it worked?
but now I have another problem.... how can I remove all the packages I don't use? do I have to do it by hand?
well yeah
but is it possible that I remove something that will make my ubuntu don't work anymore?
no, it won't remove anything necessary for the computer to work
it overwrites the old stuff
why?
-rw-r--r--  1 root root 1266857 Aug 30 19:14 /boot/vmlinuz-2.6.12-8-k7
you can remove it but it really doesn't matter.
apt-get remove linux-blah-blah-blah
